translation.line: In the Year of the Ox ...
Report by the seven princes to the court ...
With outstanding, heavy ... one birth, kinsman, son ...
With outstanding, heavy extensive, merits ...

I do reverence to with a mind of warm love near the feet of the great Sī Thū, the dashi mārgōpa¬deśaka traipiṭika, the reverend Prajñendrākaravardha, endowed with exalted, heavy merits (and) extensive kuśalamūlas, and asking about his health, I, his lowly servant, make a report:
How have I, his lowly servant, become separated from the view in the land of the traipiṭika Prajñendrākaravardha. So far, I have no suffering because of my merits and kuśalamūlas (?).

I do reverence to with a mind of warm love near the feet of the great Sī Thū, the dashi mārgōpa¬deśaka traipiṭika, the reverend Prajñendrākaravardha, endowed with exalted, heavy merits (and) extensive kuśalamūlas, and asking about his health. *Why do I not die ... (?). And my suffering has no remedy (?).

I, miserable, make a report at the feet of my dear father, the ṣau Staḍesä(?), and my mother, the lady Vidyehe. and my own sister, the lady Paḍa Tcū Kye, and the lady Kha Cū Lye, asking about their health.

translation.line: Information and report of the servant Chikä Gūlai and Dūṃ Saṃgalakāṃ. When to us, humble
servants in Ganzhou they sent a royal order: “you must lead the princes to Ganzhou,”
the order was not “you must see to the clothes and pack animals of of the traveling princes.” And when (we) the humble servants came to Radnahä:,
when we (went to) see to the pack animals, then not one of the princes’ monastery servants remained. All
had fled. The pack animals they had they had given no fodder at all. And we humble servants too
were not able to make a report to you in the vaṣṭa that we are not reporting to you that the pack animals are emaciated.
He orders the kaṇas to say “the servants do not wish to go,” and we went according to the order. When
we had set out upon the road, it was not there the earth of ... and on the road
(there was) fear of enemies. And when we came to Stahä: Biśīʾ, there
we got into company with some Cimūḍas all the way to Shazhou. Whatever formerly of servants we ... and the princes,
we came to Shazhou in *safety. Whatever accordingly(?) pack animals remained for us, vaʾstairmas—men
and provisions—and the Uigurs, all of those the Cimūḍas broke up(?). Whatever pack animals we had,
all of those had gone on the road *frightened, and thus they remained. As for the prince from Gūmattīra, he
had three camels—not a single one had gotten away—and he made it to Shazhou with only one vaʾstairma horse.
As for the second, Prince Stąmä, he had three camels and two horses. He brought only one
camel to Shazhou. From Ysbaḍä Parrūṃ to Shazhou he went all on foot. As for Prince
Thiyä Tcnä, he had four camels. Only one of them made it to Shazhou, which we *mingled among (those of) the Cimūḍas. As for Prince Yiṃnakä, he had six camels. Three of them made it to Shazhou
and one horse. As for Prince Śvakala, only one of his camels made it to Shazhou. The master of Drvāttīra’s
camel, which they had bought from the jiedushi (military governor), it was able to go only two ... in one day.
And only one of his horses made it here.
Whatever good or inferior merchandise we had, which we had brought here, which
was in my hand, that we gave to the Cimūḍas as padaṃjā. Whatever ... remained for us, that the Cimūḍas
broke up. And we came to Shazhou empty-handed. The pack animals had gone off *frightened and were lost. Next, as for
the royal gift of the Turkish councilor (öge) in the pack of the master of Gūmattīra, that
the Cimūḍas then carried off. If you had deigned order us humble servants that
“on our (your?) road there are ... Cimūḍas,” (then) we, the humble servants, *would have understood* his ... speech, that ‘so we
have to go,’” (and then) in only ten days we would have reached Radnahä: (and) there would not be upon us here one hair’s (worth of) quarrel. Only, we began to quarrel, because one former ... and
two vaʾstairmas, and thus we broke (them) up. As for Ttūra the ttāttāhä: (toto©) (and) Uhaḍpī (Üg(ä)alpï), they lost (their) merchandise ...
And at the same time the Uigurs brought us three horses. As for Nayū Chārä,
a *Sogdian, he did not bring us a hair. His pack animals were all lost. And the merchandise

he had hidden in the mountains when the king(?) came there, and he did not find a hair there; The Cimūḍas had dragged it all off. Naked here he is. When Saṃgalakāṃ escaped hither to Shazhou (to look) for pack animals, all the pack animals there

they had sent to the army in Ganzhou. I did not find a single animal. When we, humble servants, came to Shazhou, whatever army there was, it was (already) the second month for it. Thus ... ten, fifteen
days passed since they went to Ganzhou, and the army then came. As for the officer (buyruq) Attęmä ūha: uha ya
Vairä uha: uha: uha: and Kṅūrapa Sah:nä uha: and the officer Cnä Ttāhä: and the officer Mīṅamūkä, Dūṃ Ttāṃga and Saraihä: Chārä Aha:cī,
they, now, (being) fugitives with an army of Shazhou’ese, they went away (and came back) here to Shazhou. Thus, because
afterward they slew the Khagan and placed there the tàizi (‘ w) Tegin, so then
all the bādūnas (buduns) blamed these fugitives that “as long as we have dwelt here the disturbances in the land
have not ceased (and) that is your fault!” Then Begrek
*made love to the Lady of the Khagan in Ganzhou, and she became *pregnant. Then he *addressed the army in Shazhou:
“However many powerful Uigurs there are in Ganzhou, we will slay (and) ... them all!
Let the jiedushi sit in the manner of the councilors in Suzhou. From the city he sees to us here in Shazhou. And
there will not be a xa©an, either!” And when the Buduns learned about his doings} And then the men
just abandoned the land, because the Uigurs began killing them all. For the Uigurs
were all the same! The went outside the city, and in the city there are only the dūṃs, and in the city they have neither
food nor animals. Now it has been more than a month here, and still no word
is coming about how it is in the city. As for Biḍagā Sahnä (Bilgä sa©un) he was next with the Uigurs,
and the men who were with Begrek fled. And a wife could not at all *protect (her) sons.
Naked they came here. As for the buduns in Ganzhou, they are now three factions.
As for the Ttūḍīśa and Ttūrkä Bayarkāva and Hāttäbara and Īcä Iṃjūva, they are seated at Yīpäknä Ttahä: and Beḍä-Darūkä
All the Uigurs are seated at Karattahä: and Karattaha.
As for the dūṃs and *robbers and *merchants, they (are) in the city. As those three factions now all
do not agree together, no envoy can enter Ganzhou at all. On one hand there is chaos, on the other hand
there is no food there. When the entire army had come to Shazhou and when seven eight days had passed,
then we sent word there to the jiedushi at the court and to Begrek at the court
that “the princes who are here are reverend ones; they have no enemies at all; let us tentatively
send one or two men to Ganzhou and let them investigate what is said of good and bad, and we
will go then.” But then they said here in Shazhou that “that’s no problem at all; send (your) men! but the greater
man shall not go!” And we began to send him wheat. But then Begrek Attęmä the councilor dūṃ sent men
to Saṃgalakāṃ and invited him to his house. And he said to us: “How
can you now send a man to Ganzhou? On *what shall he go? He who was U©uz councilor, he since died. Caraihä:
uha: they seek among whatever(?) mountains. And Ahacī, he is (in) Shazhou. He who is khan,
he is still a child. At present his order does altogether not go in the city. The man who goes without him,
him the ttattaras will kill on the road. How (is it?) today(?) in Ganzhou? Whatever Uigurs
they meet living outside the city, those Uigurs are (almost) dead of hunger. At present they altogether
get to examine their own(?) new ones. They do not send (them off). Wherever there is no detailed knowledge(?) of the road,
there is no road even for a single man!” So the councilor said: “... so the reverend ones will go empty-handed!
Who will lead them along the road? If there are no Uigurs, who will lead them? With what will they go? Without him, because(?) the Uigurs living
outside the city and the Cimuḍas will not kill them. They will make them (mere) *shepherds!
There is no other way for them. They are the king’s sons. Thus they are obliged. If they get to China, if
it is well for them there or bad, it is their parents’ land. Here
they will become the servants of the Uigurs and Cimuḍas. Who will bear such an evil name!” That is the extent of the state of the road here. Suddenly there was a road
for (your) humble servants, but we were not able to report anything to you, because
one could only ride in very small stages(?). All this stuff he conveyed among the Cimuḍas to Shazhou according to the custom(?). It is gone.
We have nothing at all here. As I now hear, it will be time for Ganzhou. All different
new land-keepers, councilors and officers are settling themselves there. For them all will go well, if only the road is opened.
As for the old men, who received many royal favors, they are all destroyed. Then there is a great
name (= rumor?): “Seven princes have arrived and great envoys to China and 600 jin jade!”
But neither the princes nor the envoys have anything to bring(?) any more. If to us to the court (in Shazhou?), according to the royal
knowledge now one order comes that “if there is not even the smallest thing (left), without anything that road can not be
broken open or it was very difficult for me.

translation.line: We make a report to the court.
The seven princes, we went out in front of the royal sight (saying) “we are going to gūttauṣąnä.”
The order was for us “do not stay long in Shazhou.” When we gave Capastaka a report for you,
till now he has not yet directed (us) to Ganzhou. All the animals our men had are lost. Our clothes are lost.
... there is for the animals, nor for clothes. A there is no one with whom we can get out (and go to?) Ganzhou.
And the animals Ttaya-śāṃ had, they were since lost. There is nothing any more for the horses,
nor any clothes. Neither Chīkä the prramāṃ nor Ḍū the puye has any animals. How (can) we then
come to Shuofang, since we have neither gift nor letter for the Chinese king? Things for food and drink
will go ... How can even so much(?) favor extend to us? Till now there in Ganzhou many
men have died. We have no food. How were then an order to come? How can we have to enter a fire (from which) we can not bring ourselves back!

-au -āṃ

translation.line: ... like the path of the standing buddhas.
... with the four saṃgrahavastus, all the many beings ... In births after births he(?) gave
many pure *gifts. He bound to them exalted vows in birth after birth.
May they succeed for him on account of (his) merits, those vows, quickly. The dashi himself
bound (vows), Tcaina pa, he our teacher. Whoever writes ... to the city of Nirvana.
He leads from on high always ... How can he not go to release, for ... the great Pai dashi
Pauṇeprrasa? ... like moons(?) if his life increases. For a long time in happiness,
in ... Lead us always like a straight thread to the mouth (of deliverance?). The vaineya ... in the whole world
for him who helps them there is a path to the city of Nirvana. The dade Javaittapūña equipped with all merits, awakened, having recognized the path(?), speaking ..., splendid, *shining,
dear to every one, full of faith, very nice. The dade Pūñadrajaya ... with all merits ...

translation.line: In the Year of the Monkey, the 24th day of the month of Cvātaja.
order — 25th day
To the ... Thyai Tvąnä Kāṃ ... They who were your parents, they ...
served many lord kings. As
since then you grew up, you went to the feet of your parents
(and) singlemindedly placed yourself in their service. Now
I have ordered a favor to be found for you. For the ... of Śāṃ-śū
I have ordered a favor to be found. When you hear the order, from today
onward you must do the work of Śāṃ-śū. Take heed that it does not become a ... for you here (?). As for

translation.line: To Jsīna Marca. If now,
on the tenth day of the month of Hamārīja, the rays of the land (of China?) deign to radiate out to the army. When they order the army to come to them, *they order the army there to be led
among the Khyeṣas. When you hear the order, whatever
) ... sections(?) there are of infantry soldiers,
lead all those according to the old written insctructions of .... The following (are the ones for whom?)
grapes(?) are to be brought as village tax as profit for the infantry soldiers(?): (names).
The following (are the ones for whom?) clothes ... and
dry grapes (are to be brought): (names).
When I come to the Khyeṣas, if there is one *army leader
according to the order, they have made ...
they order (you) to request very many blankets for clothing.
The order (went out) on the 28th day of the month of Kaja of the fourteenth regnal year of the Tianxing era, in a Year of the Pig (= 963). We ordered tthem to be placed in (our?) jurisdiction.

comments.comment: On the back of Chinese sutra Fo shuo guanding suiyuan wangsheng shi fang jing tu. Lines 67-97 in KT I-III, p. 147 (88). School exercise, Khotanese alternating with “Gostana Sanskrit” and model lines with copies in an unskilled hand frequently degenerating into mere scrawls (all of which were read by Bailey—probably correctly). Lines 39-65 letter/report with a date (lines 63-64) in the 14th regnal year of the Tianxing era, Year of the Pig (963).
(1-3 poorly shaped repeated groups of akṣaras)
B’s narauttarauttarau bhavattai narvātta ca aṣṭa- is a lapsus.

translation.line: I thus report to the court.
In reverence to my father Ima Ttaiha:tcana, equipped with exalted, heavy merits and roots of goodness, like the great sun I report an inquiry about his health.
Prince Halai(?), if ... where ...
... how ... may be, thus I went to Gumattīra (monastery) ...
... where ... the pupils of the dashi we are practicing restraint.

translation.line: ... on the [fifth] day you should go out (= leave).
And Cīka Gūlai deigned (send) an order to Dūṃ Saṃgalakā (?) that “As long as no order comes here
you can not go to the Land (= China).” I put a detailed report in the hand of Saṃgalakāṃ, but
no order came to me saying what I shall do. [25] He who is the jiedushi in Shazhou, he said: “To us here
no order has come at all regarding you, saying what you shall do. What are you doing here that you do not go away? [27] Even here in a foreign land
I have some stuff. And there are many envoys here, eastern ambassadors (ttūṅa-śīya = dongshi œ S) and others. When they ask us
“what are you (all) doing that you do not go away?” I do not know at all what you tell them(?).
Into whatever(?) villages in the land you go, the court ambassador (ttiṅa-śī = tingshi æ S) would come; and he brings us ... respect.
They do not at all take our men into account(?) {And those people with you then went, according to the royal order.} the way it may be proper for them. [29] When the order comes to us (telling us)
... what we shall do, being in a *foreign land ... we shall die right away. [30] We then put the detailed
information and report to you in the hand of Majarūṣa (about) how there is only hardship for us here.
If now the (humble) servant commits any faults toward the royal court, the men there will altogether daringly rush to his side. They will send no men to the side of humble servants.

comments.comment: Letter on the back of Chinese sutra Fo shuo guanding suiyuan wangsheng shi fang jing tu. The conservation paper now covers much of the top line as well as several line beginnings (as can been in the SD plate), but Bailey’s first reading antedates this. It is the end of P 2898 (KT II, p. 116 (62)). New edition in Kumamoto, 1991a.
On the back of Chinese Saddharmapuṇḍarīka-sūtra.

comments.comment: IOL Khot S. 20-21 originally one scroll “consisting of two portions of differing sizes, which are sewn together along narrow edge” (Hoernle). IOL Khot S. 20 contains three “registers of sheep in the year chia-shên ... (924? or 984?)” arranged in 4 + 8 + 3 columns (Enoki). No Khotanese.

On a-side, 11 columns of a Chinese text “[w]ritten from left to right. It seems that the text concerns praying to Buddha for good luck in the future and in the travel of an embassy of Khotan sent to Tun-huang under the rule of Chang Chin-shan,” probably dated 922 (Enoki). After this starts Ch.i.0021a.a. On the b-side is the text Ch.i.0021a.b.

translation.line: (1) Reverence to the buddha kings, Āryāvalokiteśvara and all the others, – (2) arisen from that lineage of the vajra, born in a jewel, upholders of the consecration. 1.

Born in a lotus, arisen in a lotus, having the nature of truth (tathatā-prakṛti), his name Not Empty, a buddha lion, – great example of profit for all the buddhas, as well as the best bodhisattvas, having reached the bhūmis. 2.

(4) The arhats and hearers, as well as the rhinocerus-horned ones (= pratyekabuddhas) who deign to remain in the sphere of the dharmagarbha. – (5) I have escaped to the .. sphere of the dharmadhātu, full of the nature of truth (tathatā-prakṛti), having the nature of extinction (śamatha-prakṛti), pure. 3.
(6) Awakened in the sphere of nirvikalpa, clean, gone out from the fruition of the bodhi-citta. – Sāmbhogakāya and nirmāṇa(kāya), exalted, (7) for the sake of all beings in the five gatis,

They emit their rays of compassion, the elixir of life (amṛta-rasāyana), so that beings may not go to apāyas for a long time, – (8) But they pronounce exalted instructions according to the Law, they take births here as prophesied by the buddhas.
Having perfect view (samyak-dṛṣṭi), (9) of pure lineage, royal, issued from the family of King Mahā¬saṃmata, – Vaiśramaṇa, the lord Aśoka, King Cayaṃ, the milk-giving (10) lady goddess of the earth,

the increasing protector, guardian, envoy(?) Avalokiteśvara, exalted bodhisattva, – (11) arisen worthy of the rule over the Jewel Land of Gostanadeśa, to that king of Gostana, the bala-cakravartin-rāja,
(12) rājeśvara alone ... in all of Jambudvīpa, of the sons of sons(?) of that king heroic, daring, – (13) a king subduer of all kings, the best of rulers over all kings,

the transformation (nirmāṇa) of Maitreya manifest for a hundred births; (14) to him Śakra, Brahma, and also Nārāyaṇa, Maheśvara, – Skandha, Varuṇa, the king of nāgas, eight bodhisattvas, eight guardians, (15) King Jetasambhava(?), the lady goddess,

and also the guardians of the (four?) directions, the four guardians of the nāgas, Śukhūṇa, Śakhīma the yakṣas, Dīśamūka, – (16) next Grahavadatta, ... and also the gods and goddesses, the guardian nāgas, gave the kingship, all the marks of the king,
(17) equipped with the royal members of the cakravartin, and the seven jewels ... they spoke, – (18) they established the kingship, the name of king, victorious in the reign of the vajra,

Śrī Viśaʾ Dharma, bodhisattva and king, like a lamp (19) the lord Śakra might shine among the Thirty-three gods, among the gods, – like that (he) is ... among the kings of Jambudvīpa, (20) the gracious shizun.

Of that Viśaʾ Dharma, bodhisattva and king, it was the fifth year, the head (being) (the regnal period) Zhongxing, – and the horse led (21) the year [= 982], the month (was the) seventh, when there arose for him according to his mind, the divine wish,

the desire for a queen, pure, born among the Chinese, (22) with a view to the continuance of the golden kingly family. – He deigned send envoys hither to Shazhou, a full hundred and fifteen, (23) of heroic roots, best sons of the best,

all equally meritorious, youthful, worthy of display, ..., virtuous, heroic, (24) meritorious, believing, ..., of (good) family, eminent; – ... of those best ones ..., at all times at peace, Yāṃ the thye-śī, (25) covered with all virtues, born with knowledge and grown in knowledge,
speaking tasteful and sweet (words), ... in senses, heroic, (26) he saw much in the lands, – having the qualities of a good man, meritorious, Sera the hvūṃ-śī, second in rank of the envoys.
Famed, heroic, peaceful, energetic, (27) mild, Cā the kama-śī the best of all virtues, – those (three) went as envoys according to the order here to Shazhou.

Like the land of gods (is) the city of Shazhou, like a lamp, pure (like) gold melted a hundred times, – or like a peak studded with jewels, brilliant, beautiful, like that that land shines together with (its) king.

... in this entire Jambudvīpa (36) there are sixteen lands, 86,000 cities, of the lands in this entire Jambudvīpa are inhabitants(?) – with (complete) senses (31) performing good deeds, believing, heroic, knowledgeable, valiant in giving, like in our Golden Land (32) ...

Then there is in Shazhou the Gūmattīra (monastery), beautiful, quite marvelous displays of buddhas (and) bodhisattvas, – difficult to construct, so beautiful, marvelously made, marvelously constructed. For many belief is quickly born (34) in (their) mind who have seen the dear sight of the buddhas.
And their sins are destroyed, their commotions are calmed, (35) the acts smeared with kleśas, all those are destroyed for them. – Among those envoys folly and ignorance, like the śala tree ...
(36) ... when a hare steps there ...

comments.comment: “Panegyric to king Śrī Viśaʾ Dharma” (Dresden, 1977a). Late formal ductus. The date in lines 20-21 [13] = 982. Lines 1-3 photo in Enoki (C. 109). Cf. the beginning of Ch.i.0021b.b (IOL Khot S. 47).
This line was apparently lost in the conservation process.

recto.line: || vi ja ni vi vī āṃ ha ṣṭi mye ha ḍai ką̄ śa ra pä hī sī dä hī śa ni jį ka tha vī āṃ ą̄ di kau
kvāṃ bu rä ka tha ṣṭą̄ rai tcą̄ re cai gą̄ nä drai ha ḍāṃ jsye śa di bi di pa ḍą̄ ysa ka tha
śa ra ḍū gä ną̄ mä ttye jsi pa jsa ha ḍāṃ jsye śa di bi dä tcī nä hau ra la kä ną̄ mä ttye jsa dva ha
ḍvāṃ jsye śa di bi di ī ca ha na ga rä ną̄ mä va ra vi ną̄ ha ga ra dri ya sa khą̄ rma ṣṭą̄ re
ttye jsa dri ha ḍāṃ jsye śa dä bi dä ka tha ya bha gau ną̄ mä hau hä ttā jä hī ye ttā jä
hī ye ka ma la bi dä va ra au na tcū rmye ha ḍai ka kvā ha rtcai ną̄ ma kī tha ṣṭe dī
na ā ṣai ja ttā ja śā mi stä ttye biṃ dä ttā jä śą̄ mį sta ga rä u va ra ṣiʾ ka tha va rä
au tcū rmyai ha ḍai prrū śa vā hī yai bā ḍi biṃ dä hī sī dä va ra va ysa rnī je ū
ca hī yai ka ma la na rau me va ra va pa ḍą̄ ysa ka tha ṣṭe sya diṃ ną̄ mä ną̄ ha ga rä
sa khā rma va dra yi va ra au kṣa ha ḍāṃ jsye śa di biṃ dä ka tha ṣṭe bau rbu ra nau mä sī
na nau ma va mi sta ttā ja ṣṭe va ra hva ṇḍa bya ḍāṃ biṃ di ttrą̄ mī di sa khā rma va tcau ra
hvą̄ na ttā ja au va ka rą̄ nä ttye jsa ra vya pa nva ttā je mi sta ka tha gī ḍa gī ttä
ną̄ mä sa gī jä va ra va sa khā rma ha ṣṭä rrāṃ dä hī ye au mä va rä tcau rvā bā
ḍvā ttye jsa ra vye pa hī dva kṣī rā ṣṭä pa di ttye ysa rnī jį nva ttā jä va ra va ttā ja ra ga biṃ da
mi sta kṣī rä ṣṭe śī la tha sa nau mä va ra ttye hvā nä ttā je au va ka rą̄ nä ttā ji hye ra
ga bi dä drą̄ mä pā tca hā bya ḍä jsa ttrą̄ mī dä sī ḍa tha sä au nä au di ttī
ḍī bhu rai ha ṣṭa ha ḍāṃ jsya śa dā ṣṭe ra vye pa vā ṣṭa ttye nva ttā je tha rkye ha mā re
ba nā ve ttī tta de va dā rä va ra va ma ka la mū ñī dä ttī ḍī va ma ga la ca krra nau
mä rre mū ñe ṣaʾ pa ḍą̄ ysa ka śmī rā ṣṭä hī dvāṃ ga ka tha ṣṭe ga ra biṃ dä va re śau
ra vye pa ma hu vi ttā ja ra ga biṃ di ttī ḍī ą̄ nä ra vye pa vā ṣṭä hī dva kṣī rā ṣṭä
dva ha ḍāṃ jsya śa dį bi dä bau rī ne mi sta ga ra ṣṭe sa rgū ṇi ną̄ mä
ttu śą̄ ha ḍā vi he ṣṭä ha me ttye dī sa tha rä pa ḍą̄ ysa au ṣṭe ma rka ṭa gra
ma ną̄ ma va ra va ka rą̄ na drai sse ttye jsa ra vye pa dva ha ḍā jsye śa di biṃ dä ą̄ ṣṭe va
rṇa va lā ną̄ mä ttye ra ṣṭä au ba hau ysna ṣṭą̄ re mi stä pa sse ttye jsa ra vye pa dva ha ḍāṃ
jsa śa di bi di mi sta ą̄ ṣṭe ma na tta pau rṇa ną̄ mä va ra bi hą̄ ysa śą̄ mi sta pa jsa ysą̄ ra va ka
pī lye ṣṭą̄ re ttye jsa ra vya pa drrai ha ḍā jsya śa di bi di kṣī rä ṣṭe na la pa ṭa na nau mä mi sta va ra va bi
hą̄ ysa ṣṭe śą̄ ha ḍāṃ jsye śa dį bi di ka pī lya va pa jsa ysą̄ rä ṣaʾ bi hą̄ ysa vī ysā je
hī ye ra ga biṃ dä sa khą̄ rma va drra yi sa gī jā ga vāṃ jsa ttye ra ṣṭä vī ysāṃ je ka śmī rą̄ ṣṭa
ną̄ va va dāṃ pa dä a dį ṣṭä dä kṣī rā ṣṭä śą̄ ha ḍāṃ jsvi va ra ka tha a de ṣṭä ttye a di ṣṭä nä ka the dra yi
śą̄ mį vī tta sa ną̄ mä ñą̄ hye ṣṭą̄ re va ra vi mi stä ną̄ vi bį sta ysą̄ re ñū hūṃ jsa dä bī są̄ vi jsā
śą̄ ma ka tha hya vī ysāṃ ja ṣṭe ṣaʾ ka tha śau ha ḍāṃ jsa ha bi sta na va di rye ka śmī rä mi sta au va ṣṭą̄
rre kṣa ṣṭa ysā re ṣaʾ śau āṃ drai sse ysą̄ ka rą̄ nāṃ u śau ka rāṃ drai sse kṣa ṣṭyāṃ bī sā jsa va
ra va mi sta da ma rā śą̄ʾ sta sa khą̄ rma ṣṭą̄ re pa sse sa gī jā ga vā jsa ñā tta ra sa khą̄ rma
a ha khī ysa rre va a bį ma nya gau ptä ną̄ mä ha sti pha rā ka hī na bā yą̄ ve tcau rä
hī na ssa byū ra ssa byū rä ā ysī rāṃ jä bi śä

transcription.prose:
|| vi janivi vī āṃ haṣṭimye haḍai ką̄śarapä hīsīdä hīśanijį katha vī āṃ ą̄di kau-
kvāṃ burä katha ṣṭą̄rai tcą̄re caigą̄nä drai-haḍāṃjsye śadi bidi paḍą̄ysa katha
śaraḍūgä ną̄mä ttye jsi pajsa-haḍāṃjsye śadi bidä tcīnä haura lakä ną̄mä ttye jsa dva-ha-
ḍvāṃjsye śadi bidi īcahana garä ną̄mä vara vi ną̄ha gara driya sakhą̄rma ṣṭą̄re
ttye jsa dri haḍāṃjsye śadä bidä katha yabhagau ną̄mä hauhä ttājä hīye ttājä
hīye kamala bidä vara auna tcūrmye haḍai kakvāhartcai ną̄ma kītha ṣṭe dī-
na āṣaija ttāja śā mistä ttye biṃdä ttājä śą̄ mįsta garä u vara ṣiʾ katha varä
au tcūrmyai haḍai prrūśavā hīyai bāḍi biṃdä hīsīdä vara va ysarnīje ū-
ca hīyai kamala naraume vara va paḍą̄ysa katha ṣṭe syadiṃ ną̄mä ną̄ha garä
sakhārma va drayi vara au kṣa-haḍāṃjsye śadi biṃdä katha ṣṭe baurbura naumä sī-
na nauma va mista ttāja ṣṭe vara hvaṇḍa byaḍāṃ biṃdi ttrą̄mīdi sakhārma va tcaura
hvą̄na ttāja auva karą̄nä ttye jsa ravya pa nva ttāje mista katha gīḍagīttä
ną̄mä sagījä vara va sakhārma haṣṭä rrāṃdä hīye aumä varä tcaurvā bā-
ḍvā ttye jsa ravye pa hīdva kṣīrāṣṭä padi ttye ysarnījį nva ttājä vara va ttāja raga biṃda
mista kṣīrä ṣṭe śīlathasa naumä vara ttye hvānä ttāje auva karą̄nä ttāji hye ra-
ga bidä drą̄mä pātca hā byaḍä jsa ttrą̄mīdä sīḍathasä aunä audi ttī-
ḍī bhurai haṣṭa-haḍāṃjsya śadā ṣṭe ravye pa vāṣṭa ttye nva ttāje tharkye hamāre
banāve ttītta devadārä vara va makala mūñīdä ttīḍī va magalacakrra nau-
mä rre mūñe ṣaʾ paḍą̄ysa kaśmīrāṣṭä hīdvāṃga katha ṣṭe gara biṃdä vare śau
ravye pa mahuvi ttāja raga biṃdi ttīḍī ą̄nä ravye pa vāṣṭä hīdva kṣīrāṣṭä
dva-haḍāṃjsya śadį bidä baurīne mista gara ṣṭe sargūṇi ną̄mä
ttu śą̄ haḍā viheṣṭä hame ttye dī satharä paḍą̄ysa au ṣṭe markaṭagra-
ma ną̄ma vara va karą̄na drai-sse ttye jsa ravye pa dva-haḍājsye śadi biṃdä ą̄ ṣṭe va-
rṇavalā ną̄mä ttye raṣṭä au bahauysna ṣṭą̄re mistä pa-sse ttye jsa ravye pa dva-haḍāṃ-
jsa śadi bidi mista ą̄ ṣṭe manattapaurṇa ną̄mä vara bihą̄ysa śą̄ mista pajsa ysą̄ra va ka-
pīlye ṣṭą̄re ttye jsa ravya pa drrai-haḍājsya śadi bidi kṣīrä ṣṭe nalapaṭana naumä mista vara va bi-
hą̄ysa ṣṭe śą̄-haḍāṃjsye śadį bidi kapīlya va pajsa ysą̄rä ṣaʾ bihą̄ysa vīysāje
hīye raga biṃdä sakhą̄rma va drrayi sagījā gavāṃ jsa ttye raṣṭä vīysāṃje kaśmīrą̄ṣṭa
ną̄va-vadāṃ padä adįṣṭädä kṣīrāṣṭä śą̄-haḍāṃjsvi vara katha adeṣṭä ttye adiṣṭänä kathe drayi
śą̄mį vīttasa ną̄mä ñą̄ hye ṣṭą̄re vara vi mistä ną̄vi bįsta ysą̄re ñūhūṃjsadä bīsą̄ vi jsā
śą̄ma katha hya vīysāṃja ṣṭe ṣaʾ katha śau-haḍāṃjsa habistana va dirye kaśmīrä mista auva ṣṭą̄-
rre kṣaṣṭa ysāre ṣaʾ śau āṃ drai-sse ysą̄ karą̄nāṃ u śau karāṃ drai-sse kṣaṣṭyāṃ bīsā jsa va-
ra va mista damarāśą̄ʾsta sakhą̄rma ṣṭą̄re pa-sse sagījā gavā jsa ñāttara sakhą̄rma
ahakhīysa rre va abįmanyagauptä ną̄mä hasti pharāka hīnabāyą̄-v-e tcaurä
hīna ssa-byūra ssa-byūrä āysīrāṃjä biśä

translation.line: From the Land on the eighth day they come to Kāśarapä. From the Iron City to
Kaukvāṃ there are four Chinese towns. For a stretch of three days, the first city

is called Śaraḍūgä. From it for a stretch of five days there is (a city) called Tcīnä Hauralaka. From it for a stretch of two days there is (a city) called Īchanagarä. There, on a mountain top there are three monasteries.
From it for a stretch of three days there is a city called Yabhagau at the head of a wide river. From there on the fourth day there is a city called Kakvāhartcai. Below
a lake is a river. Along that (river) is (another) river (and) a great mountain, and there is that city.
From there on the fourth day they come into the territory of the Prrūśavas (Burusho). There,
the head of a golden river comes forth. There is the first city, called Syadiṃ. On a mountain top
there are three monasteries. From there for a stretch of six days is a city called Baurbura.
There is a great river called Sīma. There the men enter (the river) on inflated skins. There are four monasteries.
*Along the river are villages (and) karānas. South of it along the river is a great city
called Gīḍagīttä (Gilgit), made of stone. There are eight monasteries. The residence of the king is there in four lands(?).
South of it is the road to India, along that golden river. There on the shore of the river
is a great city called Śīlathasa. There *along the river are villages (and) karānas on the shore of the river. Again, they enter it with that kind of inflated skin. From Sīḍathasä to Ttīḍī
there is a stretch of eight days. To the south hither along that river there are walnut trees, jack fruit, balsam pear, (and) deodar (trees). There monkeys dwell. In Ttīḍī
dwells a king called Magalacakra. This is the first Indian city (on the road) to Kaśmīra. One of its *gates is on a mountain.
To the south, on the shore of the Mahuvi river, south of Ttīḍī hither, (on the road) to India
for a stretch of two days, there is a great snow-covered mountain called Sargūṇi. One can descend it in one day. Below it in *rocky place is the first town, called Markaṭagrāma.
There there are three hundred karānas. To the south of it, (after) a stretch of two days, there is a town
called Varṇavalā. *Throughout that (town) are five hundred large bazaars. To the south of it, (after) a stretch of two days,

there is a large village called Manattapaurṇa. There is one large bazaar (and) five thousand kapīlaya trees. To the south of it, (after) a stretch of three days, there is a land (city?) called Nalapaṭana. There there is a large bazaar.
For a stretch of one day there are five thousand kapīlaya trees. That bazaar
is on the shore of a lake. There are three monasteries with cells of stone (in rock?). *All along that lake there is
a ... road to Kaśmīra. To the land of Adiṣṭädaṃ is a one-day (stretch). There is the city of Adiṣṭaṃ. That city of Adiṣṭaṃ has three

entrances. They are from(?) the river called Vīttasa. There there are 20,000 large boats. The western entrance is in the lake of the city. That city is continuous for a one-day (stretch). In all of Kaśmīra there are
60,000 great towns. That (particular) one consists of 300,000 karānas, and (each) one karāna of 360 houses. There,
there is a large monastery with a dharmarāja (stupa) (and) 500 rock cells. Smaller monasteries
are countless. The king there is called Abimanyagaupta. (There) are many elephants. He has four army leaders.
The army is 100,000 (and/times?) 100,000, all in armor.

comments.comment: Travel report (itinerary). Late cursive ductus. Ed. with plates Bailey, 1936. See also Morgenstierne, 1942.
See Studies I, pp. 50 (ttīta) and pp. 83-84 (banāte).

translation.line: In the Year of the Tiger, the month of Kaja, here in Yutian ...
born from ... seven princes there were.
He, when ...
where there is no good ...
... with exalted merits and roots of goodness ...
(Sanskrit)
the buddha(s) all that ... realized bodhi
there in the monastery the towns(?) that day by day(?) they see good in the world ...
... by name ...
... the manner of that ... was thus, that ...
... from the belly there dwelt a little bird(?) ...

... marrow was born.
At that time there in Rājagṛha it was said in land by land(?) Jātamaha ...
... by name they made. But whoever in the world thus obtain sons and daughters those brothers ... for that reason ...
... they see how that prince will grow they became ... at all times in the future they will be better
... the reverend ...
(spell)
In a distant land near with warm friendly mind equipped with exalted merits and roots of goodness
... great gift experience not before him(?). Khviṃ Raka(?) who had deigned remember ...
I make a report thus to the court, the humble one, dwelling in Phęma(?), ...
... merits they sent to us, who was angry with us(?) ...
This Prajñāpāramitā is very profound, faith [should be ...-ed] in it.

comments.comment: Site mark Ch.0046. Top portion of Ch.0050b (IOL Khot S. 36), with which it joins with narrow sliver missing. Almost identical text repeated five times (exercises), twice upside-down at beginning of the scroll (1-2), and three times on the rest of the scroll (3-5). (1-2) are written in less polished script than (3)-(5). Edges now covered by conservation paper. Written on the back of Chinese Vajracchedikā [T. 8, no. 235, pp. 751A20-B5 + B5-22].
(1) At top of S. 36, upside down. Bailey’s Ch.0050b2.1-3.
Subscript -ū but not clear which letter is intended (here and next); B. suggests dū, but dū in the syllabaries is different. – b. Not B. (here and next).
(3) Above 1.1 going in the opposite direction. Bailey’s Ch.0050b1.1-5. Above the text one Sogd. word.
Like ū but with two diacriticals to the right instead of one (here and the rest).
(4) Below 3.5. Bailey’s Ch.0050b1.6-8 + a1-3. The join between S. 36 and S. 35 is in line 4.3 (Bailey’s b8 = a1), mostly covered by conservation paper.
Two joining pieces mounted together. With Ch.0050a (see IOL Khot S. 35).
Recent Chinese inscription in red ink identifying the text on the recto as Jingang ming jing. [Stein’s Ch.00120 is IOL Khot S. 7.]

Mounting paper has: (1) “00328” (in black ink) with “a” added in pencil; (2) “9.I.54” in pencil (date of conservation?). Bottom of Ch.00329 (IOL Khot S. 40). On the back of Chinese Mahā¬prajñāpāramitā-sūtra.
Mounting paper has Ch.00328b. Chinese in cursive Khotanese Brāhmī. One side only.

translation.line: I am asking. There *with you in a distant land, born, alive, ...
... jewel of men, if you are at peace, then also healthy.
Then I am happy because of your joy. If Kūṃ Ṣa has come here
among the hills, ... has sat upon the waves (?) and there
he spoke.

comments.comment: Top of Ch.00328a. The first line of Ch.00328 = last line of Ch.00329 (the vowel marks on Ch.00329.6 go on top of akṣaras in the first line of Ch.00328a). The two pieces fit together perfectly, but the conservation paper now covers top and bottom lines and right margins. Note the use of rr, which is quite distinct from dr. On the back of Chinese Mahā¬prajñāpāramitā-sūtra. Cf. Or.8210/S. 5212.
No top vowel marks on preceding three akṣaras.

Long (70 ft 10") scroll containing various Khotanese and “Gostana” Sanskrit texts. Complete photo edition Takubo, 1975. Guide2, pp. 21-22.

translation.line: The saṃgaka Śāṃ Khṅä Óvāṃʾ ordered (this) to be written in love of the the most supreme buddha-bodhi. May his life increase, his sufferings disappear! In the Year of the Hare, on the first day of the 5th month, in the nakṣatra of ārdra, in the town of Ṣacū, it was completed and finished.

na mau a mi tta mi rä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä cvai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe ttrī ya śūṃʾ ra
ysaṃ thä ni nā sti : na mau a kṣu bhä gya stä baʾ ysä cvai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe baʾ
śę bi saṃ gą̄ nī hva ḍä kha ṣṭä a nā va rą ṇä gva śte de śa nai hi me : :
na mau ra tna ke ttä gya stä baʾ ysä cvai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe tti rä brrų̄ ñaṃ dai hi me
khu raṃ nī nę da śäʾ : na mau a rmyā yä gya stä baʾ ysä cuai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe ha
ṣṭā kū la ka lpa va ṣṭä bi sāṃ haṃ jsāṃ da ka rma ba śdeʾ ttai jā re • ma ra
ṇā ve su hā va ysaṃ thä nā sti na mau dūṃ du bhi sva rä gya stä baʾ ysä cuai
ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe di di rī śi rkä ba jā ṣä hi me khu gya stų ña kū sä pāʾ he || na mau ra tna
kū sū ma gu ṇa sā ga ra vai ṇḍū rya ka na ka gi ra sū va rṇa kāṃ ca na pra bhā sa śrī
ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä cuai nā ma hvą̄ ñe ha rbi śāṃ ba rī jāṃ si ją̄ ma
bye he tsā hi me sū hye : na mau su da rśaṃ gya stä baʾ ysä cuai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe
ka lpa sthya tī ka rma ba śde jā re dye na śi rkä hi me prra ysā : na mau vi rau caṃ
gya stä baʾ ysä cuai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe dā tī nai tta raṃ da rä bye he || na mau gaṃ dhau
ttaṃ gya stä baʾ ysä cuai ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñe ysaṃ thvā tī ttu rrna va sva ū pa lä spye hī
ya bu śä na rą me ni ni kū ṭhe gvā ysai ye || na mau a pa ra mi tta gū ṇa
ra tna śryī vyū ha te ja rā ja ka lpo ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau : na mau sa rva dha
rma pra tti bhā sa vyū ha śrī ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau || na mau a pa ra mi tta pra
tti bhā sa vyū ha saṃ cī rṇa bū ddhau ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau || na mau sa ha srra me
gha ga rji tta sva ra rā jau ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau || na mau sū va rṇau tta ma prra bhā
sa śrī ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau || na mau ba hū vi vi dha te jau rā ja śrī ni rbhā sau
ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau : na mau a saṃ khye ya ka lpa kau ṭī sa mu dā nī tta bu dhiä
ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau || na mau śu bha ka na ka ga ga na ni rnā da vyū ha ni rbhā sau
ną̄ ma ta thā gana mau sa rva dha rma na ya vi ku rva tta tte jau ną̄ mau tha thā ga tau • •
na mau gu ṇa saṃ kū su mi tau ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau 10 1 cu ṣiʾ cu ttyāṃ gya stāṃ
baʾ ysāṃ ną̄ me sā je vā śeʾ o vā pyū ṣḍi śe śe baʾ ysä ną̄ ma hvą̄ ñą̄ me
jsa ka lpa sthya ka rma jā re śeʾ na ysa thä na baʾ ysū śti bū tte : na mau sa mā
dhi ha stau ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ : na mau sa mā dhi ha stau ta ra pa dmau
ta ra na kṣa tra rā yä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ : na mau pa dmau ta ra
śrī ną̄ ma gya sta baʾ ysä na ma suṃ : na mau pa dma ha stau ną̄ ma gya sta baʾ
ysä na ma suṃ : na mau sū rya ma ṇḍa la pra bhā sau tta ma śrī ną̄ ma ta thā ga tau
na mau sa rva sū ryau tta mā gna pa ri pu rṇa la kṣa ṇa kā ya gā tträ ną̄ ma gya stä
baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ : na mau e ka ra tna cha trä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ
na mau sa rva sa mā dhi ru tta ma vi krrą mä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ : ||
na mau ra tna kū su mi tta sa maṃ ttā va bhā sa śrī ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ :
na mau a nu tta ra pa dma vi krrą mi ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ : na mau a
naṃ tta ga dhau tta ma rā yä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ : na mau ra tna pa dma
vi krrą mä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ na mau ra tna ma ṇḍa la tte ja sa mu dga ta
prra bhā sau ttaśrī ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ : na mau ra tna ga rbhä ną̄ ma gya
stä baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ || na mau ra tnau ttą mä ną̄ ma gya sta baʾ ysä na ma sūṃ •
na mau sa rva ra tna prra tta mą ṇḍa ta rū pa dha rī ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ
cu ṣiʾ cu ttyāṃ gya stāṃ baʾ ysāṃ ną̄ mi pa rī pī ḍe au vā śeʾ a na tta na ryą̄
nī ka rmāṃ de śa na hi me di di rū jsa pa ri lo ka bą nya sa tva pa rsī dä khu
gaṃ gä nyā ya gruī cyau sya ni va ra bya mā tce rā || na mau bha ga va te ga ga na
śrī rā ja vi ma la rā ja sa ma ni yi ni ru ca ri gu ṇa ke tta prra bhū pa dma
kū sū ma gū ṇa sā ga ra vai ṇḍū rya ra śmi ra tna biṃ ba kā ya ga ndha va ra prra
va ra vi ma la pa ttiā bhaā rca vi ci tra sa ma laṃ krra ttiau ṣṇī ṣa mu rdha
a pa ri ma ta su rya pra ti bhā sa ra śmi ra tna caṃ drra pra tti mą ṇḍi ta sū ni
rma tta prra ṇi dha gū ṇa vyū ha dha rma dhā ttua tyu@ dga ttaa ṣaṃ ga ra tna rā
jä ną̄ ma gya stä baʾ ysä na ma suṃ : na mau bha ga va te va jrra sā ra prra ma
rrda nā ya ta thā ga tā ya rha te sa mya ksaṃ bu dhā ya • ta dya thā
auṃ va jrre va jrre • ma hā me gha bu dha pū ja ttā va jrre • ma hā te ja va jrre
ma hā vī ra va jrre ma hā bau dhi cį tta va jrre • ma hā baumą ṇḍā pa saṃ
ma ṇa va jrre sa rva ka rmā va ra ṇa vi śu dha na va jrre svā hā || ||

transcription.prose:
saddham\ dvāsä kūla gyasta baʾysa ratnauttama ną̄ma bīśūṃ namasuṃ nauda :
haṣṭusä kula gyasta baʾysa ratnāvabhāsa ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda
bistä kūla gyasta baʾysa śikha ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : bistä kū-
la gyasta baʾysa kāśava ną̄ma biśū namasuṃ nauda || kṣase kūla gyasta
baʾysa vimalaprrabha ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : sparanau kūla gyasta baʾ-
ysa śākyamuna ną̄ma biśūṃ namasum nauda : haṣṭase ysāri gyasta baʾysa
eṃdrradhvaja ną̄ma biśū namasuṃ nauda haṣṭase ysāri gyasta baʾysa suprra-
bhāsa ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : nau kūla gyasta baʾysa kṛkisuṃda ną̄-
ma biśuṃ namasuṃ ną̄da : haṣṭusä kūla gyasta baʾysa kanakamuna ną̄-
ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : drraise kūla gyasta baʾysa avabhā(sa)śrya nāma bi-
śū namasuṃ nauda : sparabistä kūla gyasta baʾysa puṣya ną̄ma biśūṃ
namasūṃ nauda : dvāsä kūla gyasta baʾysa vipaśa ną̄ma biśūṃ nama-
sūṃ nauda : dvī ysāri kūla gyasta baʾysa kauṭęña ną̄ma biśū namasūṃ
nauda : haṣṭā kūla gyasta baʾysa svabhāvadharmauttara ną̄ma biśūṃ namasūṃ
nauda : paṃ-ysāri gyasta baʾysa prrādyautta ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda paṃ-se
gyasta baʾysa prrattāpąna ną̄ma biśū namasūṃ nauda || haṣṭā ysāra gya-
sta baʾysa nāga ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : paṃ-ysārä gyasta baʾysa
sālarāja ną̄ma biśū namasūṃ nauda : haṣṭa-se gyasta baʾysa śama-
tha ną̄ma biśūṃ namasu nauda : dasau ysāri gyasta baʾysa prrasana-u-
tpalagandhakūṭa ną̄ma biśūṃ namasuṃ nauda : biśīda gyasta baʾysa hi-
māre haṃbaʾcä jsa tcahauʾse kūla pīrma haṣṭusä lakṣa byūrri hauda ysā-
ri haṣṭa-se • cvaṃ ye ną̄ma byehe pyūṣṭi ṣiʾ drrayāṃ (avāyāṃ) paṃda basti • ni ni na-
rya jsāte ni prrīyvā ni ttrīyaśūṃʾ cvaṃ sāje samādą̄nuṃ jsa bāye ṣiʾ baʾ(ysū)-
śtä jsa atīsaṃdai hime ni vara byaṃmā tcerā : namau ūttarapradīpä
gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ni na garkhyau āchyau haṃthrrīśtä ||
naumau jauttasaumyagaṃdhāvabhāsaśrī ną̄ma gyastä baʾ(ysä) cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe na
na strīya hime odä baʾysuśtä : namau jñānaulko gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ
cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ni ni avīśäʾ mahānarī ysaṃthä nāstä || namau aṣaṃga
rājä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe amauvuā byūṃgvā
baṃdanaśālvā na kaśte : || : namau anaṃttayaśä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä
cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe biśau gajsyau jsa pahaiṣṭä hime || namau merä ną̄ma gyastä
baʾysä • cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe narya ni ysaṃthä ni byehe || namau mahāmeru
ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe prrīyvā ra ysaṃthä ni nāste :
namau amittamirä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ttrīyaśūṃʾ ra
ysaṃthä ni nāsti : namau akṣubhä gyastä baʾysä cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe baʾ-
śę bisaṃgą̄nī hvaḍä khaṣṭä anāvarąṇä gvaśte deśanai hime : :
namau ratnakettä gyastä baʾysä cvai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ttirä brrų̄ñaṃdai hime
khu raṃnīnę daśäʾ : namau armyāyä gyastä baʾysä cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ha-
ṣṭā kūla kalpa vaṣṭä bisāṃ haṃjsāṃda karma baśdeʾ ttai jāre • mara-
ṇā ve suhāva ysaṃthä nāsti namau dūṃdubhisvarä gyastä baʾysä cuai
ną̄ma hvą̄ñe didirī śirkä bajāṣä hime khu gyastųña kūsä pāʾhe || namau ratna-
kūsūmaguṇasāgaravaiṇḍūryakanakagirasūvarṇakāṃcanaprabhāsa-śrī
ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä cuai nāma hvą̄ñe harbiśāṃ barījāṃ siją̄ma
byehe tsā hime sūhye : namau sudarśaṃ gyastä baʾysä cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe
kalpasthyatī karma baśde jāre dyena śirkä hime prraysā : namau viraucaṃ
gyastä baʾysä cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe dātīnai ttaraṃdarä byehe || namau gaṃdhau-
ttaṃ gyastä baʾysä cuai ną̄ma hvą̄ñe ysaṃthvātī tturrna vasva ūpalä spye hī-
ya buśä narąme ni ni kūṭhegvā ysaiye || namau aparamittagūṇa-
ratnaśryīvyūha-tejarājakalpo ną̄ma tathāgatau : namau sarvadha-
rmaprattibhāsavyūhaśrī ną̄ma tathāgatau || namau aparamittapra-
ttibhāsavyūhasaṃcīrṇabūddhau ną̄ma tathāgatau || namau sahasrrame-
ghagarjittasvararājau ną̄ma tathāgatau || namau sūvarṇauttamaprrabhā-
saśrī ną̄ma tathāgatau || namau bahūvividhatejaurājaśrīnirbhāsau
ną̄ma tathāgatau : namau asaṃkhyeyakalpakauṭīsamudānīttabudhiä
ną̄ma tathāgatau || namau śubhakanakagagananirnādavyūhanirbhāsau
ną̄ma tathāga(tau) (||) namau sarvadharmanayavikurvattattejau ną̄mau thathāgatau • •
namau guṇasaṃkūsumitau ną̄ma tathāgatau 10 1 cu ṣiʾ cu ttyāṃ gyastāṃ
baʾysāṃ ną̄me sāje vāśeʾ o vā pyūṣḍi śe śe baʾysä ną̄ma hvą̄ñą̄me
jsa kalpasthya karma jāre śeʾna ysathäna baʾysūśti būtte : namau samā-
dhihastau ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ : namau samādhihastautarapadmau-
taranakṣatrarāyä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ : namau padmautara-
śrī ną̄ma gyasta baʾysä namasuṃ : namau padmahastau ną̄ma gyasta baʾ-
ysä namasuṃ : namau sūryamaṇḍalaprabhāsauttamaśrī ną̄ma tathāgatau
namau sarvasūryauttamāgnaparipurṇalakṣaṇakāyagātträ ną̄ma gyastä
baʾysä namasūṃ : namau ekaratnachaträ ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ
namau sarvasamādhiruttamavikrrąmä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ : ||
namau ratnakūsumittasamaṃttāvabhāsaśrī ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ :
namau anuttarapadmavikrrąmi ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasūṃ : namau a-
naṃttagadhauttamarāyä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ : namau ratnapadma-
vikrrąmä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ namau ratnamaṇḍalattejasamudgata-
prrabhāsautta(ma)śrī ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ : namau ratnagarbhä ną̄ma gya-
stä baʾysä namasūṃ || namau ratnauttąmä ną̄ma gyasta baʾysä namasūṃ •
namau sarvaratnaprrattamąṇḍatarūpadharī ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ
cu ṣiʾ cu ttyāṃ gyastāṃ baʾysāṃ ną̄mi parī pīḍe au vāśeʾ anattanaryą̄-
nī karmāṃ deśana hime didirū jsa pariloka bąnya satva parsīdä khu
gaṃgä nyāya gruīcyau sya ni vara byamā tcerā || namau bhagavate gagana-
śrīrāja-vimalarāja-samaniyinirucariguṇa-ketta-prrabhū-padma-
kūsūma-gūṇasāgara-vaiṇḍūryaraśmiratna-biṃbakāya-gandhavaraprra-
varavimalapatti-ābha-ārcavicitrasamalaṃkrrattiauṣṇīṣamurdha-
aparimatasuryapratibhāsaraśmiratnacaṃdrraprattimąṇḍitasūni-
rmattaprraṇidhagūṇa-vyūhadharmadhāttu-atyu@dgatta-aṣaṃgaratnarā-
jä ną̄ma gyastä baʾysä namasuṃ : namau bhagavate vajrrasāraprrama-
rrdanāya tathāgatāya rhate samyak-saṃbudhāya • tad yathā
auṃ vajrre vajrre • mahāmeghabudhapūjattā-vajrre • mahāteja-vajrre
mahāvīra-vajrre mahābaudhicįtta-vajrre • mahābau(dhi)-mąṇḍāpasaṃ-
maṇa-vajrre sarvakarmāvaraṇaviśudhana-vajrre svāhā || ||

translation.line: Welfare! The twelve billions of lord buddhas called Ratnottama, I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The eighteen billions of lord buddhas called Ratnāvabhāsa, I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The twenty billions of lord buddhas called Śikhin, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twenty billions
of lord buddhas called Kāśyapa, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The sixty billions of lord
buddhas called Vimalaprabha, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The ninety-five billions of lord buddhas
called Śākyamuni, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eight hundred thousand lord buddhas
called Indradhvaja, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eight hundred thousand lord buddhas called Suprabhāsa, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The ninety billions of lord buddhas called Krakasunda,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighteen billions of lord buddhas called Kanakamuni,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The three hundred billions of lord buddhas called *Avabhāsaśruta,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twenty-five billions of lord buddhas called Puṣya,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twelve billions of lord buddhas called Vipaśyin, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The two thousand billions of lord buddhas called Kauṭinya, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The eighty billions of lord buddhas called Svabhāvadharmottara, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The five thousand lord buddhas called Pradyota, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The five hundred
lord buddhas called Pratāpana, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty thousand
lord buddhas called Nāga, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty thousand lord buddhas
called Sālarāja, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eight hundred lord buddhas
called Śamatha, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The ten thousand lord buddhas called Prasanna(-vadana)-utpala-gandha-kūṭa, I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The (lord) buddhas everywhere, altogether forty billions, eighteen lakhs, seventeen thousand,
eight-hundred in front, whover hears their names, he has closed the path to the three (apāyas). He also does not go to Hell, nor to the ghosts,
nor to the animal state. Whoever teaches them, gains concentration (samādhāna) from it, he becomes a non-returner from bodhi.
No doubt should be entertained there.
Hail to the lord buddha Ratnaketu! He who speaks his name will become as brilliant as a bejeweled banner.

Hail to the lord buddha Amitāyu! He who speaks his name, the acts and sins accumulated during eighty billions of eons will disappear for him; upon death he will obtain rebirth in Sukhāvatī. Hail to the lord buddha Dundubhisvara ...
Hail to
the tathāgata called Aparamita-guṇa-ratna-śrī-vyūha-teja-rāja-kalpa! Hail to the tathāgata called
Sarva-dharma-pratibhāsa-vyūha-śrī! Hail to the tathāgata called
Sahasra-megha-garjita-svara-rājo! Hail to the tathāgata called Suvarṇottama-prabhāsa-śrī!
Hail to the tathāgata called Bahu-vividha-tejo-rāja-śrī-nirbhāso.
Hail to the tathāgata called Asaṃkhyeya-kalpa-koṭi-samudānīta-buddho.
Hail to the tathāgata called Śubha-kanaka-gagana-nirnāda-vyūha-nirbhāso.
Hail to the tathāgata called Sarva-dharma-naya-vikurvita-tejo.
Hail to the tathāgata called Guṇa-saṃkūsumito. 11. He who
learns, recites, or listens to the names of these buddhas, by the speaking of the name of each buddha,
(his) karmas will be destroyed for eons. In one birth he will realize budhdahood. Hail!
I do homage to the lord buddha called Samādhihasto!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Samādhihastottarapadmottaranakṣatrarāya! Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Padmottaraśrī!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Padmahasto!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Sūryamaṇḍalaprabhāsottamaśrī!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Sarvasūryottamāgniparipūrṇalakṣaṇakāyagātra!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Ekaratnachattra!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Sarvasamādhi-r-uttamavikrama!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Ratnakusumitasamantāvabhāsaśrī!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Anuttarapadmavikrama!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Anantagandhottamarāya!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Ratnamaṇḍalatejasamudgataprabhāsottamaśrī!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Ratnagarbha!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Ratnottama!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha called Sarvaratnapratimaṇḍitarūpadhārī!

Whoever orders the names of these lord buddhas to be written or pronounces them will have confession of the acts (that would lead to) unending hells. So many beings imprisoned in the world beyond will escape through him as the grits and sands of the river Ganges. No doubt should be entertained there.

Hail! I do homage to the gracious Lord Buddha called Gagana-śrī-rāja-vimala-rāja-samanaya-nirucira-guṇa-keta-prabhū-padma-kusuma-guṇa-sāgara-vaiḍūrya-raśmi-ratna-biṃba-kāya-gandha-vara-pravara-vimala-pati-ābha-ārca-vicitra-samalaṃkṛtauṣṇīṣa-mūrdha-aparimita-sūrya-pratibhāsa-raśmi-ratna-candra-pratimaṇḍita-sunirmita-praṇidhi-guṇa-vyūha-dharma-dhātu-atyudgata-aṣaṃga-ratna-rāja!
Hail! I do homage to the gracious Lord Buddha called Vajra-sāra-pramardana tathāgata ʾrhant samyak-saṃbuddha! Tad yathā ...

recto.line: • • ttū na mau bha dra ka lpya sū ttri u sū dhą̄ na pa tträ sū tträ u kū lyāṃ ja
stāṃ baʾ ysāṃ hī ye ną̄ me • śāṃ khį̄ ṅä hvāṃʾ : saṃ ga kä pa sti pī ḍe • baʾ ysą̄ ña
baʾ ysū śti brrī ya • jsį̄ nai hu ṣī ye pī lai vya chīṃ de • tti ṣṭāṃ pu ña rrvī vī
buʾ ysye jsį̄ ña vī prri yau ga ja hai śūṃʾ u tti ṣṭāṃ pu ña hvū : śęʾ na pa ḍi māṃ tcū kyi
na haṃ brrī he u hā ysi na ysdi śau gū tti rä hvā ra kyāṃ brrā ta rāṃ jsa haṃ brrī hūṃ :
bi śä sa tta baʾ ysa ha māṃ de • tti pā a baʾ ysä ha mą̄ ne nau da : ṣiʾ sū tträ
pū hye mā śti 20 mye ha ḍai • ṣa cū kī thi ą̄ na pu rva bha dri va na kṣaʾ trä vī śviʾ ha
ḍā sa rvā kā rä dā śe :
na mau ra tna ttrī yā ya na ma hä : sa rva dū rga tta pa ri śau dha na rā jā ya • ta
thā ga ttā ya rhe tte są mya saṃ bu dhā ya tta dya thā oṃ śu dha ne śu dha ne sa rva pā pa śu dha ne śu dhe vī śu dhe sa rva ka rmā va
ra ṇa vī śu dha ne svā hā :

transcription.prose:
• • ttū namau bhadrakalpya-sūttri u sūdhą̄na-patträ sūtträ u kūlyāṃ ja-
stāṃ baʾysāṃ hīye ną̄me • śāṃ khį̄ṅä hvāṃʾ : saṃgakä pasti pīḍe • baʾysą̄ña
baʾysūśti brrīya • jsį̄nai huṣīye pīlai vyachīṃde • tti ṣṭāṃ puña rrvī vī
buʾysye jsį̄ña vī prriyaugaja haiśūṃʾ u tti ṣṭāṃ puña hvū : śęʾna paḍi māṃ tcū kyi-
na haṃbrrīhe u hāysi naysdi śau-gūttirä hvārakyāṃ brrātarāṃ jsa haṃbrrīhūṃ :
biśä satta baʾysa hamāṃde • tti pā a baʾysä hamą̄ne nauda : ṣiʾ sūtträ
pūhye māśti 20 mye haḍai • ṣacū kīthi ą̄na purvabhadriva nakṣaʾträ vī śviʾ ha-
ḍā sarvākārä dāśe :
namau ratnattrīyāya namahä : sarvadūrgatta-pariśaudhana-rājāya • ta-
thāgattāya rhette sąmya-saṃbudhāya ttad yathā oṃ śudhane śudhane sarva-pāpa-śudhane śudhe vīśudhe sarva-karmāva-
raṇa-vīśudhane svāhā :

translation.line: Homage to this Bhadrakalpika-sūtra and the Sudhānapattra-sūtra and the names of the billions of lord
buddhas. Śāṃ Khṅä Hvāṃʾ Saṃgakä ordered (this) to be written
in love of the buddha-bodhi. May his life increase, his sufferings disappear! I give these merits to the court
for long life. And I share these merits with Óvū Śęʾna Paḍi Māṃ Tcū Kyi(na),
and I share (them) with the brothers and sisters of the same family near and far.
May all beings become buddhas! And then may I too become a buddha. Reverence! This sutra
I Sarvākāra(?) finished on the twentieth day of the fifth month, in the city of Shazhou, under the (25th) asterism of Pūrvabhādrapada at midday.
(Skt:) Hail to the three jewels! Hail to the king who purifies all evil states, tathāgata ʾrhant samyak-saṃbuddha! Tad yathā. Om! ... For the purification of all the impediments of all deeds!

comments.comment: Lines 840-48 more cursive than the rest of the text.

recto.line: su mu kha ną̄ ma ma hā yą̄ na su trä dā yya byą̄ ja jsī ñi ką̄ʾ ka vī jya ṯ naʾ u
spu rra dā śyā || || ttū na mau su mu kha sū ttri śāṃ khį̄ ṅä hvāʾ : saṃ ga kä pa sti pī ḍe buʾ ysye jsį̄ ña
hu ṣą̄ me u di śā yi : pī la a kā la ma ra ṇai vya chą̄ me pa ri va rttą̄ me vī ra tsīṃ de • nau da : sa hai ci
sa lya nau mye mā śti pū hye : ha ḍai ṣa cū kī thi ą̄ na sa rvā kā ri dā śe : ||

transcription.prose:
sumukha ną̄ma mahāyą̄nasuträ dāyya byą̄ja jsīñi ką̄ʾka vījya ṯnaʾ u-
spurra dāśyā || || ttū namau sumukha sūttri śāṃ khį̄ṅä hvāʾ : saṃgakä pasti pīḍe buʾysye jsį̄ña
huṣą̄me udiśāyi : pīla akālamaraṇai vyachą̄me parivarttą̄me vīra tsīṃde • nauda : sahaici
salya naumye māśti pūhye : haḍai ṣacū kīthi ą̄na sarvākāri dāśe : ||

translation.line: The Mahayana sutra called Sumukha, the devotion to the Law, the knowledge protecting life, is finished (and)
completely completed. Homage to this Sumukha-sūtra! The saṃgaka Śāṃ Khṅä Hvāṃʾ ordered (this) to be written with a view to prolonging life.
May sufferings and untimely death go to disappearance and turning around(?)! Hail! In the year
of the Hare, the fifth day of the ninth month, in the city of Shazhou, I finished it completely.

comments.comment: End and colophon (cursive) of the Sumukha-dhāraṇī.

recto.line: sa ddha m\ dvā sä kū la gya sta baʾ ysa ra tnau tta ma ną̄ ma bi śūṃ na ma suṃ nau da ha ṣṭu sä kū

translation.line: Welfare! The twelve billions of lord buddhas called Ratnottama, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighteen billions
of lord buddhas called Ratnāvabhāsa, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twenty billions of lord buddhas
called Śikhin, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twenty billions of lord buddhas called Kāśyapa,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The sixty billions of lord buddhas called Vimalaprabha, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The ninety-five billions of lord buddhas called Śākyamuni, I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The eighteen billions of lord buddhas called Indradhvaja, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eight hundred lord
buddhas called Suprabhāsa, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The ninety billions of lord buddhas called Krakasunda,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighteen billions of lord buddhas called Kanakamuni,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The three hundred billions of lord buddhas called Avabhāsaśruta, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The twenty-five billions of lord buddhas called Puṣya, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The twelve
billions of lord buddhas called Vipaśyin, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The two thousand billions of lord buddhas
called Kauṭinya, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty billions of lord buddhas called Svabhāvadharmottara,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty billions of lord buddhas called Candrasūryapradīpa, I do homage to them all.
Reverence! The five hundred lord buddhas called Pratāpana, I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The five thousand lord buddhas called Pradyota, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty thousand
lord buddhas called Nāga, I do homage to them all. Reverence! The five thousand lord buddhas called Āditya,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eighty thousand lord buddhas called Sālarāja,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The eight hundred lord buddhas called Śamatha,
I do homage to them all. Reverence! The ten thousand lord buddhas called Prasannavadana-utpalagandhakūṭa,
I do homage to them all. Reverence!
The (lord) buddhas everywhere, altogether forty billions, eighteen lakhs, seventeen thousand, eight-hundred in front, whover hears their names becomes a non-returner from bodhi.
In the eastern direction I do homage to the lord buddha Akṣobhya. In the western direction I do homage to the lord buddha Amitāyu.

In the northern direction I do homage to the lord buddha Dundubhisvara. (In the southern direction I do homage to the lord buddha Ratnaketu.) In the first subdirection I do homage to the lord buddha Dharaṇiṃdhara.
In the second subdirection I do homage to the lord buddha Candraprabha. In the third subdirection I do homage to the lord buddha Nārāyaṇa.
In the fourth subdirection I do homage to the lord buddha Śāntendriya. The Lord Budddha Ratnaketu, the lord buddha Bhadraśrī, the lord buddha
Vairocana, and all the other lord buddhas together with their assembly I, Śāṃ Khṅä Óvāṃʾ the saṃgaka,
I do homage to standing in the five-maṇḍala.
Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Maitreya. 1. Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryāvalokiteśvara! 2.
Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha! 3. Hail!
I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Mañjuśrī! 4. Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Kṣitigarbha! Hail! I do
homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Bhaiṣajyarāja! Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Samantabhadra! Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Vajrapāṇi!
Hail! I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Māṇabhāva! Hail!
I do homage to the bodhisattva Āryā-Dharmodgata!
Hail! I do homage to the elder Piṇḍurabharadhvāja. Hail! I do homage to the elder Kanakavatsa. Hail!
I do homage to the elder Bakula. Hail! I do homage to the elder Abhija.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Kanakabharadhvāja. Hail! I do homage to the elder Kāṇḍa. Hail! I do homage to the elder Vajriputra.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Gopaka. Hail! I do homage to the elder Parhaika. Hail!
I do homage to the elder Rāhula. Hail! I do homage to the elder Nāgasena. Hail! I do homage to the elder Iṃgaṇḍa.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Ajita. Hail! I do homage to the elder Vanavāsa. Hail! I do homage to the elder Aniruddha.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Cūḍapathai.
Hail to all the buddhas standing in the ten directions (and their) world spheres, such as Bhūje, etc.

recto.line: tti ku lyāṃ bha drri ka lpyau ja stāṃ baʾ
ysāṃ u bau dha sa tvāṃ u a ra haṃ dāṃ sthī rāṃ hī ye ną̄ me • śāṃ khį̄ ṅä hvāṃʾ : saṃ ga kä pa sti pī ḍe • buʾ ysye jsį̄ ña prri yau
gä u di śā yi • jsį̄ nai hu ṣvī ye pī la a kā la ma ra nai vya chīṃ de • nau da : sa hai ci sa lya da sa mye mā śti 8
ha ḍai • pū rva bha dri va na kṣaʾ tträ vī ṣa cū ą̄ na dā śe nau da : || : tti ṣṭāṃ pu ña mā rā pya rāṃ jsa haṃ brrī he cu pa
rya īṃ de ttyāṃ ga vi śe ṣäʾ ha mā te • cu jūṃ dā ṣṭāṃ de ttyāṃ jsį̄ na hu ṣvī ye • tti ṣṭāṃ pu ña hā ysi na ysdä hvā ra kyāṃ
brrā ta rāṃ jsa haṃ brrī hūṃ • haṃ bi stä ṣṭą̄ ną āṃ baʾ ysū śti pa ri ṇą̄ mūṃ nau da :
|| na mau ra tną ttrī yā ya • na ma hä : sa rva dū rga tta pa ri śu dha na rā jā ya • tta thā ga
ttā ya rhi tte są ma saṃ bu ddhā ya • tta dya thā auṃ śu dha ne śu dha ne sa rva pā
pa śu dha ne • śu dhe vī śu dhe • sa rva ka rmā va ra ṇa vi śu dha ne svā hā : :

transcription.prose:
tti kulyāṃ bhadrrikalpyau jastāṃ baʾ-
ysāṃ u baudhasatvāṃ u arahaṃdāṃ sthīrāṃ hīye ną̄me • śāṃ khį̄ṅä hvāṃʾ : saṃgakä pasti pīḍe • buʾysye jsį̄ña prriyau-
gä udiśāyi • jsį̄nai huṣvīye pīla akāla-maranai vyachīṃde • nauda : sahaici salya dasamye māśti 8
haḍai • pūrvabhadriva nakṣaʾtträ vī ṣacū ą̄na dāśe nauda : || : tti ṣṭāṃ puña mārā-pyarāṃ jsa haṃbrrīhe cu pa-
rya īṃde ttyāṃ ga viśeṣäʾ hamāte • cu jūṃdā ṣṭāṃde ttyāṃ jsį̄na huṣvīye • tti ṣṭāṃ puña hāysi naysdä hvārakyāṃ
brrātarāṃ jsa haṃbrrīhūṃ • haṃbistä ṣṭą̄ną āṃ baʾysūśti pariṇą̄mūṃ nauda :
|| namau ratnąttrīyāya • namahä : sarva-dūrgatta-pariśudhana-rājāya • ttathāga-
ttāya rhitte sąmasaṃbuddhāya • ttad yathā auṃ śudhane śudhane sarva-pā-
pa-śudhane • śudhe vīśudhe • sarva-karmāvaraṇa-viśudhane svāhā : :

translation.line: Those names of the billions of bhadrakalpika lord buddhas
and bodhisattvas and arhats and elders, the saṃgaka Śāṃ Khṅä Hvāṃʾ ordered (them) to be written with a view to the requirement for a long life.
May his life increase, may sufferings and untimely death disappear! Reverence! In the Year of the Hare, the eighth day of the tenth month,
under the (25th) asterism of Pūrvabhādrapada in the city of Shazhou, I finished (it). Reverence! I share those merits with my parents, who have passed on.
May there be a special place (gati) for them. Those who are alive, may their life increase! I share these merits with the sisters
and brothers near and far. Having shared (them), may I ripen them for bodhi. Reverence!
Hail to the three jewels! etc.

comments.comment: Lines 1101-1106 more cursive than the preceding text; lines 1107-1109 larger cursive.

Hoernle’s “Ch.i. 0021. b.” Vajrayāna texts. Guide2 [18.37]. The manuscript contains three texts: Ch.i.0021b.b (65 lines) covers the whole of one side; Ch.i.0021b.a (47 lines) covers four-fifths of the other side; the third text (13 lines) covers one-fifth of the same side, but starts at the opposite end of the manuscript, so that the ends of the two texts meet (cf. Ser., p. 1452). The third text was not read by Bailey; only individual akṣaras can now be identified, and it is not certain that it is part of Ch.i.0021b.b, though it is possible. Present location unknown. Photo B13451-58 and microfilm. Photos and microfilm are difficult to read; the present text is after Bailey. Cā Kīmä Śanä also wrote the Jātakastava (Ch.00274, IOL Khot 65-82).

recto.line: mveʾ śdiʾ jsa va rą ha kṣį pa ttrī nä : ttu ki ttā kai tta «†» a kā ṣṭa na ha rśtą ṣaʾ ja na ye dau ṣką
ca jä b·e yse bā ḍä nva ha kṣa hau ḍau dä se dä ū vā rä :a sa dyau kī ryą̄ jsa cū vā ysa
nū gu ṣä : hū rya ra bvā ṣṭa jsa ttu mä śpa rra ṣṭä : a mrra tta kūla krrā da rā ji «† pa»
pa ysnä : a rpa hiʾ krrā dä nī lä da ṇḍä pa cī ḍivi ·y· pä ā staṃ nä hau va
nä mį stą : dā ra ñā hvą̄ ṣṭä a śi grī va hū da hä : dva ṣa ṇḍį bhū ji ca rä
pū rva kä mā lä : ʾī chā bī dau bi tcū rä śau mī śe rkarhą̄ śai hai rū kä
pī rmā ttaṃ piṃ jsą drā vi ṇṇḍą krrā di ca ra kī la kī lä krrā di a ca lä ṭa ki rā
jä : hą yą grī va pa cī ḍa : mā hā bi lą : a mä sų bā hyį a sī da ka
rma :a są da ra ṇą̄ na ṣṭę vā kä va jrrā ṇḍā są krrā di : ha ṣṭą̄ ysā rä yą̄
geʾ śū ri krrā da na rā kṣįʾ : ha rbī śu na mū sūṃ a ysą jsą̄ ṇä kyä ṣṭą̄ nä : pa
śa rū hū rya rau se ddha ū vā räṇį heʾ jä ra bį śa dī śāṃʾ byį na dāṃ
ra va jrra kū śa ā staṃ nä dvā ra pą̄ lä tca hau rä : ha ṣṭa pū ji nī yi :
ha ṣṭį mā tta ra pā tcä : ttā rā gyį ʾe ki gya ṭi lą ttrī lā kyi tta gā rä :cū tta
mā rī ca se da lā ca ni nvę yą brrū kū ṭä ā ra ttā rru cū ra va jrra śa kha lä : ā
ra mū mä kä są ra svą ra ya nī ḍa tta ra di ra ttrā mī ryau ha mi rrvā micvi ra jsā
pī lä ma ra ā chai pvę ṇi : ha tha rkyi gā rī yų hū nä vī śuʾ nä a maṃ ga lī yi
pa va svyį hī ra ʾī de bī śi byą̄ jä rä tta tta khva pā śą ra bau rä :dre ṣṭrri saṃ nā hi ·i
da saṃ tta mä kā hū ra ma mūäʾ śdäʾ jsä ttū sę da ū vā rä : khvi ra jsä vę rśuʾ tvā sa
dį na nva tte ttī ma hā bū vā hye de va tta pā tcä :ka dabā ją stą : śa krra kṣe
yį da rū ṇi : ha tsa pa rvā ra jsa mi hā kę tta yau di tta ra da rä dā tta vi khva mū ñī da
ra ṣṭį : a ma nū ṣa rą̄ jä pa jsa hau va nä mi sta :cu ra dī śā pā la ha ṣṭį gū tta
rä nā va : pa jvą̄ kū lvā a hä rī na ka pā tcä ma ṇḍa lä sthāṃ prrą̄ tta de va tta bī
śä ha rbī śū ha bai sta saṃ cū bū rä ha mā vai :ma hā vā spau śī ryā mūʾ śd·ʾ
nai tceṃ nä jsä bye hūṃ mū ysaṃ thi ma ra ma drvā sę dä : va ñä ra ttū biʾ ysų̄ ñi są
mį byā va yi nī ryā khva na rū pą ra be ysų̄ śti ttye ha kṣa prra bą̄ va nä
bau ga va krrā ddha rā ji hī yai ttu pa rau ū vā rä : na pa hai jä rä ra ṣṭä vī khva
na jī ryā bį śa : cu bū ra mä va jrra dā ttä ttye ma ṇḍa lä vī rä vya cha vą dā va gya
sta bę ysą ha mī ḍiha rā śaʾ ra bā ysvę mä beṃ dā ṣṭį va ysñą : byā ji ra ki
rma jī nya ra vā ysni pyą̄ mä : cū bū ra vā ysaṃ thvā a ysą ja ḍī prra cai ā
va rṇä ha jsä deṃ bę śdeʾ ga rkhyeva ñi a ma dā yį bai ysų̄ ñä są rą̄ va hū ryi
rä de śa nä ka rmā na bī śāṃ : a nā srrą rī sa va ra ṣaʾ sū rai ha mā vai a
dī śāʾ ka rma a ysä ma na ttā tsī mesaṃ tsā ra myą̄ ñä dū khāṃ va ṣa yā byę dä
śe na tcū nä rru di bve ysą jsī nä ha mā ve gya śtä rī ñä rai ysdvą rāṃ re spū rāṃ ha
bai śa ysa tha va ṣṭä jā sa ma ra ha mā naisī jā ñā ka ma drā bai śa pī cha ṣṭa se dä
tsą sų̄ hye bā ḍa saṃ pa tta sau hi yau dį hų̄ ṣī ma rrjsāṃ jāṃ deṃ ka rma cā ki mä
śa nä cu rä śuʾ steṃ tvā de śa nä a ysä vya chī męra ṣṭyį va svą dā ya prra rą
vī jsyā nai va jrra są tva pa ṣąʾ jsa hä tcą bye hī ne pī rmā ttä lāä yī sę dä
cū bu rä jsā bā vī nai lā kā tta rä : ha rbī śä sī jī ye ña vā nä ra ysgą tī
sū mī ra ga rä śa śvā jsā ttī ma ha ma gä • sū mī ra ga rä pū ṣą ttrā yau tta śa śvāṃ
myą̄ ñä bī śī hā bai śnä ha tsa tcau ryā dvī pyau : ttra hi są lya pā saṃ tsā rī bai śa
bā va ña gī śī ñättī drā mū jsi ha rbai śa ttrvā yį stā są jsā ṣkāṃ jā vī na
ra na pa dī mä ṣkā ja hū rrā gye ma ja hū są bya da nä ma jsą ha spī są jau yi jā ma na ma sącū ttį krrī yāṃ ū
vā rä gya stu ñi gueṃ pū ṣa dyau va jrra są tva tcau ryā bvai yā śrrī va jrra sa
tva dį śa nä cvai cā kī mä śa nä hī ye a ysmū jsa pa dai dai ū spą̄
ra dā śā || thye na tcū nä sū hye bā ḍį pū hye kṣuą̄ ṇä pa sa sä lya ttau jį rä mā
śtä hą̄ dū są mye ha ḍai na dą va kū ṣḍvī ą̄ nä dā rā ysą nāṃ di bau dha są ttu vī śaʾ śū rä cai
ga rāṃ dā nä rrā di hī ye bve ysyęḡ ya stu ñe ū vā rye dra va rgye jsī ña prrī ū da śai yą
cā kī ma śa nä hī ye gau ttrą a ysmū jsą e drai jsa śuʾ ste u pa dai dai u pī ḍai || ||

transcription.prose:
(1) mveʾśdiʾ jsa varą hakṣį pattrīnä : ttuki ttā kaitta «† » akāṣṭa na harśtą ṣaʾ ja na ye dauṣką
ca jä b(v)eyse bāḍä nva hakṣa hauḍaudä sedä ūvārä : (2) asadyau kīryą̄ jsa cū vāysa-
nū gu ṣä : hūryara bvāṣṭa jsa ttu mäśpa rraṣṭä : amrrattakū(ṇḍa)lakrrāda-rāji «†pa»
paysnä : arpahiʾkrrādä nīlädaṇḍä pacīḍi (3) vi(d)y(ā) pä āstaṃnä hauva-
nä mįstą : dārañā hvą̄ṣṭä aśigrīva hūdahä : dva ṣaṇḍįbhūjicarä
pūrvakä mālä : ʾīchā bīdaubi tcūrä-śaumī śerka (4) rhą̄śai hairūkä
pīrmāttaṃ piṃjsą drāviṇṇḍą krrādi cara kīla kīlä krrādi acalä ṭakirā-
jä : hąyągrīva pacīḍa : māhābilą : amäsųbāhyį asīda-ka-
rma : (5) asądaraṇą̄ naṣṭęvākä vajrrāṇḍāsą krrādi : haṣṭą̄ ysārä yą̄-
geʾśūri krrāda narākṣįʾ : harbīśu namūsūṃ aysą jsą̄ṇäkyä ṣṭą̄nä : pa-
śarū hūryarau seddha ūvārä (6) ṇįheʾjära bįśa dīśāṃʾ byįnadāṃ
ra vajrrakūśa āstaṃnä dvārapą̄lä tcahaurä : haṣṭa pūjinīyi :
haṣṭį māttara pātcä : ttārāgyį ʾekigyaṭilą ttrīlākyittagārä : (7) cū tta
mārīca seda lācani nvęyą brrūkūṭä āra-ttārru cū ra vajrra-śakhalä : ā-
ra-mūmäkä sąrasvą rayanīḍa ttaradira ttrāmīryau hamirrvā mi (8) cvi ra jsā
pīlä mara āchai pvęṇi : hatharkyi gārīyų hūnä vīśuʾnä amaṃgalīyi
pavasvyį hīra ʾīde bīśi byą̄järä tta tta khva pāśąra baurä : (9) dreṣṭrri saṃnāhi (s)i-
da saṃttamäkā hūra ma mūäʾśdäʾ jsä ttū sęda ūvārä : khvi ra jsä vęrśuʾ tvā sa-
dį na nvatte ttī mahābūvā hye devatta pātcä : (10) kada bājąstą : śakrra-kṣe-
yį-darūṇi : hatsa parvāra jsa mihākętta yaudi ttaradarä dāttavi khva mūñīda
raṣṭį : amanūṣa-rą̄jä pajsa hauvanä mista : (11) cu ra dīśāpāla haṣṭį gūtta-
rä nāva : pajvą̄ kūlvā ahärīnaka pātcä maṇḍalä-sthāṃ prrą̄tta devatta bī-
śä harbīśū habaista saṃ cū būrä hamāvai : (12) mahā vā spauśīryā mūʾśd(ī)ʾ-
nai tceṃnä jsä byehūṃ mū-ysaṃthi mara madrvā sędä : vañä ra ttū biʾysų̄ñi są-
mį byāva yinīryā khva narūpąra beysų̄śti ttye hakṣa prrabą̄vanä
(13) bauga va krrāddha-rāji hīyai ttu parau ūvārä : na pahaijärä raṣṭä vī khva
na jīryā bįśa : cu būra mä vajrradāttä ttye maṇḍalä vīrä vyachavą-dāva gya-
sta bęysą hamīḍi (14) harāśaʾra bāysvę mä beṃdāṣṭį vaysñą : byājira ki-
rma jīnyara vāysni pyą̄mä : cū būra vā ysaṃthvā aysą jaḍī prracai ā-
varṇä hajsädeṃ bęśdeʾ garkhye (15) vañi ama dāyį baiysų̄ñä sąrą̄va hūryi-
rä deśanä karmāna bīśāṃ : anāsrrą rī savara ṣaʾ sūrai hamāvai a
dīśāʾ karma aysä ma na ttā tsīme (16) saṃtsāra myą̄ñä dūkhāṃ vaṣayā byędä
śena tcūnä rrudi bveysą jsīnä hamāve gyaśtä rīñä raiysdvąrāṃ respūrāṃ ha-
baiśa ysatha vaṣṭä jāsamara hamānai (17) sījāñāka madrā baiśa pīchaṣṭa sedä
tsą sų̄hye bāḍa saṃpatta sauhi yaudį hų̄ṣī marrjsāṃ jāṃde-ṃ karma cā kimä
śanä cu rä śuʾsteṃ tvā deśanä aysä vyachīmę (18) raṣṭyį vasvą dāya prrarą
vījsyānai vajrrasątva paṣąʾ jsa hätcą byehīne pīrmāttä lāäyī sędä
cū burä jsā bāvīnai lākāttarä : harbīśä sījīye ñavānä raysgą-t-ī
(19) sūmīra garä śaśvā jsā ttīma hamagä • sūmīra garä pūṣą ttrāyau tta śaśvāṃ
myą̄ñä bīśī hā baiśnä hatsa tcauryā dvīpyau : ttrahi sąlya pā saṃtsārī baiśa
bāvaña gīśīñä (20) ttī drā-mūjsi harbaiśa ttrvāyį stāsą jsā ṣkāṃjā vīna
rana padīmä ṣkāja hūrrāgye ma ja hūsą byadanä ma jsą haspīsą jauyi jāmana-masą (21) cū ttį krrīyāṃ ū-
vārä gyastuñi gueṃ pūṣa dyau vajrra-sątva tcauryā bvaiyā śrrī-vajrra-sa-
tva dįśanä cvai cā kīmä-śanä hīye aysmū jsa padaidai ūspą̄-
ra dāśā || thyena tcūnä sūhye bāḍį pūhye kṣuą̄ṇä pasa sälya ttaujįrä mā-
śtä hą̄dūsąmye haḍai nadąva kūṣḍvī ą̄nä dā rāysąnāṃdi baudhasąttu vīśaʾ śūrä cai-
ga rāṃdānä rrādi hīye bveysyę ḡyastuñe ūvārye dra-vargye jsīña prrī ūdaśaiyą
cā kīma-śanä hīye gauttrą aysmū jsą edrai jsa śuʾste u padaidai u pīḍai || ||

translation.line: In compassion there truth ..., ... considers, unconsidered does not remain. That was not difficult, that for a long time, according to truth they gave exalted siddhi(?).
On account of evil acts, which ... vāsanas, give ... that right road! ... Amṛtakuṇḍalin krodha-rāja, Arpahiʾ-krodha, Nīladaṇḍa in turn.
Vidyā ... and the others powerful great ones. The best of (in?) dhāraṇīs, Aśigrīva, the su/sat-puruṣa. The two, Ṣaḍbhuja-cara and Pūrvaka-māla. Icchā bīdaubi the four-faced, beautiful one.
The *five mystery-*giver(s) drāviṇḍą krodha cara kīla kīlä krodha Acala, Ṭakkirāja, Hayagrīva in turn. Mahābala, amäsųbāhyį asiddha-karma.
The burner of evil ones, Vajrrāṇḍāsą krodha, the eighty thousand Yogeśvara-krodha Narākṣįʾ, to all of them I bow and do homage. Release me(?)! Give me exalted siddhi!
Restrain the ... in all the directions, the vajra-kośa and the others, the four gate-keepers, the eight pūjaneyas(?), and then the eight mātras(?). Ttārāgyį Ekajaṭila, Trilokya-ttagārä
The things that appear as mirages ... following ... Bhṛkuṭī, Ārya-tārā, as well as Vajrra-śakhalä (Vajra¬śṛṅkhalā?) Ārya-mūmäkä, Sarasvatī, Rayanīḍa, go into (my) body, into my limbs!
Whatever sufferings, illnesses, fears, anxieties, distresses, evil dreams, unfavorable, ... things there are, make all dissolve, like snow in autumn.
dreṣṭrri saṃnāhi [s]i-da saṃttamäkā give me out of compassion this exalted siddhi! If (my?) energy does not ... this siddhi, then the deities of the mahā-bhūtas.
They look after (me/them?) bājąstą: śakrra-kṣeyį-darūṇi together with retinue Mahāketu always. Body ... if they dwell truly(?), the five great powerful amanuṣa-rājas.

As well as the protectors of the directions, the eight gotra-nāgas(?), next all the ones in the five kulas(?). All the deities prrtta of(?) the ones standing in the maṇḍala, all of them altogether as many as there are.
Look at me with your eye of compassion. Let me obtain here in this birth siddhi in the mudrās(?). Recall now this buddha ... as the nirupara(?) bodhi, by the might of its truth.
... this exalted order of the krodha-rāja. Do not ... as many here in the vajra sphere in this maṇḍala all the lord buddhas altogether who have ...
Stretch out your arms upon me now! Make the karmas dissolve, destroy the covering of vāsana! All the āvaraṇas, severe sins, I have acculmulated in births on account of folly.
Now, you buddha lions of the Law give me confession of all karmas! The ... saṃvara, may it become clean! I confess the karmas. May I not go thither!

In the middle of saṃsāra, in the domain of sufferings, may Śena Tcunä, the king’s life be long, together with the lady queen, the princesses, and the princes. May I remember all births throughout my births.

Making the mudrās succees, they all appear in full view(?). May the success and happiness of a happy time always increase! ... they have destroyed the karmas for me(?), Cā Kīmä Śanä, I who prepared this confession, may I ...

May I see the true pure nature of the Law(?). May I obtain the foremost vajra-sattva together with his assembly. May all the ... appear, all the ..., lokottara. May it all succeed ... quickly for him.

Like Mount Sumeru (and) a seed of mustard. Mount Sumeru I introduce into the middle of the mustard (seed), all of it completely together with the four continents. ... of saṃsāra then I would make turn in the bhāvana.
Then I would introduce all the ... on the tip of a hair, without the saṃskāras I would make jewels(?) ... ...
I who have ... completely that exalted buddha dhyāna(?) vajra-sattva with the four rays Śrī-vajrasattva the confession which Cā Kīmä Śanä has made with his mind is completely finished.

The fifth regnal year of the happy time (regnal period) Tianzun, in the Year of the Sheep (= 971), the month of Ttuṃjārā, the 17th day, ... residing in the palace, ruling in the Law, the bodhisattva Viśaʾ Śūra, king of kings of the Chinese—with a view to ... of his long, divine, exalted, ... life, I Cā Kīmä Śanä prepared, made, and wrote it with (my?) gotra, mind, and senses.

comments.comment: Metrical text. The date in lines 43-46 = 971. For the names see Mallmann, 1975. Provisional translation.

recto.line: si ddhaṃ au rga·ba ysų̄ ñāṃ rrā dau tā ṣṭä : ā rya vį rū ca ā sta ni ha mī ḍa ttye vī śaʾ r·
hī ye gū tte rä ni ha mye ra ni vī ysā yi :a bi ṣe kä dī jsą̄ kä vī ysa ña ysā vī ysą ña ha
mye tta tha ttā vrra rä a ttu śī mä nā mai baʾ ysu ña sa rą̄ : si ddha vī dyā da rā jų̄ hū rā ki ṇe
tcu ra va dī kī rä jsacu ·ū vīʾ de gū stya rą he śāʾ mi styāṃ tta trāṃ jsa ni ra dä va sve pā rą̄ mą pa di bā
yī dä kṣa sä • bau dha cai ttä hī vye vī vā jsa ni ra da •va jrra pā rą̄ ma baʾ ysų̄ ñä ra hā sä • tca na ṣṭāṃ
gą̄ rśte va jrrą sa tvä u vā rä • a ha rī ni baʾ ysu ñä gū ttį ra dī jsā kä : tta ni cu vī na ttī ma na ha ma vī
vā va rgą • sa vrri ni baʾ ysū śti pī rmā tta mą hvā ṣṭą •sa gra hā va syā* tca hau re muiʾ śdiʾ prra cį ną • tca na haṃ
dā ḍi sa tva baʾ ysų̄ śtā ṣṭą : ṣāʾ mā hą̄ pā rau ma gā rśti va svą : tca hą̄ ryā ddha rmyā ṣą̄ʾ cu ra hni va
jrrara hį śvā dha rmyā bvā me jsa na ra di «† j»jñā na pā rā ma pī rmā tta ma hvą̄ ṣṭa ttā hi rji me sta va sva
a dū a gų̄ pāʾ da rma va jrrą cu ṣṭā gau śte na jsa ḍa näva svą ā da rna vī ñā na rthā rą ṣṭa
ṣāʾ ka rma va jrrą cu pā rą̄ ma gā rśte • tca hau ryā pā rā mā hī yą mā vū rī nä dā na pā rą̄ ma
cvaį grū sī dą lā saṃcu ṣṭau tca rkā ñi va sva vī vā gi hni : pa jsa ge vī ra sa rva sa tvā kiṃ ṇą •
ra hi śe tca rka na ha ryā cu pa ca ḍa ni : a bī ysā dye gā ttra ni ā va stā sa tva 8cve u skha stą
pį sā re ra nyā u ḍą ttu pa rā hī ne bu tcu rru śā a ga : tta ni ṣą̄ʾ nā ma mā lą de va tta hvā ṣṭą
śī lą pā rā ma baʾ ysu ña na jsa ḍa ni : 9kṣāṃʾ tta pā rā ma ṣą̄ʾ de va tta gī ttą : ṣāʾ cu yaṃ da ʾį̄
jsiṃʾ baʾ ysą̄ nä bī śā ną : vī ra pā rau ma ṣą̄ʾ de va tta nį ttra tca na bye hī de rra ysgą na bąʾ
ysų śti hvā ṣṭi :dhyā na pā rau mä ṣāʾ de va tta pū ṣpą : a kha mį stą brrī yī ne a ga vī ką : ha jva
ttį vī ji ṣąʾ pā rau ma hvā ṣṭą ṣāʾ dhų pi de va tta ā vā ḍā lā ki : 10 1vī ra sa ñi bu śaṃ jsa
tte bvai jsī je u vā rre : cu baʾ śti tcu pa tsyā sa tsā rrve bą̄ śä : va sva prra ṇa hau ni ṣąʾ rru de

phā ka ja nā ką 10 3a ja ttą ṣą̄ʾ de va tta • mā ryau jsa a vu rrdą • bī ysā nā mi jsa bī ysā nā me
baʾ ḍa va jrra pā rā me ā kṣī va prra cį na • pa ṣṭā ña dā vī nai rra ṣṭa pa rau 10 4u ysā nā
bā tta va sva dha rma a nā tmi ṣāʾ va jrra de va tta pą̄ rā ma gā hya a na pū rrvā mi stą sa mā hā na ra

ye pa ra pā ką prra cai ną tcū ra va dye pį ṣke ca jsa ha gye ḍa sa tvą • tta na ṣṭāṃ nā ma mį hvā ṣṭa va jrra kū śą

mą va jrra sphą̄ ṭa u vā ra 10 8cu ṣṭā baʾ śa bā va sa rva da rma a nā tmä a nā sta na bā krra ʾī
